newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Low offer in Sri Lanka diesel tender from Glencore.
newsitem.headline: Low offer in Sri Lanka diesel tender from Glencore.

text.p: Swiss trader Glencore Singapore has made the lowest offer into Sri Lanka state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corp's (CPC) tender to buy 250,000 barrels of diesel for August 11-12 delivery, a CPC source said on Thursday.
Glencore's offer for the 1.0-percent sulhur diesel was at a 68 cents per barrel premium to Singapore spot quotes on a cost-and-freight (c-and-f) Colombo basis.
The next best offer was from Shell Singapore at a 74 cents premium, the official said.
The tender closed on Wednesday and will be awarded late Thursday.

In its last tender for July 27-28 delivery cargo, CPC purchased from Shell 235,000 barrels of diesel and 65,000 barrels of jet fuel at a premium of 21.9 cents and 9.4 cents, respectively, both over spot Singapore quotes on a c-and-f Colombo basis.
